title: 820-3115  running slow
message:
hello I have a 820-3115 board that run really slow I run ASD and shows the next bad sensors:

TA0P

TC0P

TM0P

Th1H

All are SMC IO those 4 fail

I replace : [SIZE=12px][FONT=Courier New] [/FONT][FONT=Courier][FONT=Courier]U5511 , [/FONT][/FONT][/SIZE][FONT=Courier][SIZE=1][FONT=Courier][SIZE=1][SIZE=12px]Q5515[/SIZE] , [SIZE=12px]Q5520 , Q5510 and I check for related resistor and caps they look good and match schematic ,[/SIZE][/SIZE][/FONT][/SIZE][/FONT][FONT=Courier][FONT=Courier] =PP3V3_S0_CPUTHMSNS is there , [/FONT][/FONT][FONT=Courier][SIZE=1][FONT=Courier][SIZE=1][SIZE=12px]R5260[/SIZE] and  [SIZE=12px]R5261 match schematic and they have voltage.

Machine still run slow.

What I should check now?

machine chime , boot , play you tube , but slow.

thank you so much.[/SIZE][/SIZE][/FONT][/SIZE][/FONT]

title: 820-3115  running slow
message: Check power to U5511, R5511/12, R5510 is suspect or trace is corroded. IO is failing so it must be power to U5511 or corroded data lines to SMC. Last thing I suspect is dead SMC. You can check bad trace to SMC with multimeter on diode mode, both data lines should be about the same value.

title: 820-3115  running slow
message: my bet goes to bad SMC, check pull up resistors R5260-R5261 should have about 3.3V on both sides of both resistors....

title: 820-3115  running slow
message:
R5260-R5261  they have 3.3v on both sides

Check power to U5511 : [SIZE=16px][FONT=Courier][FONT=Courier]=PP3V3_S0_CPUTHMSNS is the line that power this chip? if yes that read on r5510 3.3v one side 3.2v the other side.

my reading on diode mode for SMC Lines is: on r5261 pin 2 .641 pin 1 .351  , r5260 read same [/FONT][/FONT][/SIZE]

title: 820-3115  running slow
message:
Was the liquid damage in the SMC area? Could be crap under the SMC. Give it some flux and heat, do not reflow just 180C should be enough to clear the crap. 
I checked on a good board and I measure .350 and .560 on the pull up resistors so your .641 seems a bit high. Check if there in continuity from R5260/1 to U5511

title: 820-3115  running slow
message:
When PPBUS_G3H is down by about 3-4% from what it should be, SMC is not running.

Do not get discouraged or depressed, just try again. I know. It sucks. I posted a 2 hour video of just how much this sucks.. so I know.

title: 820-3115  running slow
message:
After so many attempts I would let this chip rest in peace.
Do you put new solder balls after each attempt?
If you want to be successful don't waste your time on this chip any longer:
- order a chip with new balls
- de-solder the faulty chip and remove all the excess solder off the board with your wick
- make sure the pads are as clean and even as possible
- put flux on the pads (not too much)
- align the new chip on the pads and when you're sure it is aligned push a little bit harder on it so it doesn't float on the flux
- now apply heat on the chip. make sure your air is not to high and not blows your chip away
- if the chip is only 90% aligned it doesn't mater you will see how it moves in place when the solder melts
- don't be inpatient and touch the chip while it is floating on the solder!
- let it cool down and make an inspection
- reflow if necessary
- I use a preheater to heat up the whole board for better results and less stress

I wish you success

How to - by Louis:
[url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zj9RXw6D1H8&index=20&list=PLkVbIsAWN2lvK9wLg2pwcXJLut_-_P9G4[/url]

title: 820-3115  running slow
message:
-124 means nothing is connected to the sensor. You can bridge the 2 sense wires together and I think it will read 8C or something, try if it reacts to that.
There is no way to find the exact sensor. Some diagrams have them listed and you need to figure out what they are on another diagram.
[FONT=inherit][I]I still think bad solder on U5511 or dead Q5520. Or we are looking at the wrong sensor, you can remove Q5520 and see if an extra error pops up.[/I][/FONT]
